The controls of the machine are primarily timer-controlled, with a special "cartridge dry" mode that allows the machine to dry filter cartridges without rotating the tub or advancing the timer. The machine is designed to minimize the loss of solvent vapors and prevent streaks and swales from forming on the clothes during the drying process.

<summary>
The invention relates to a method and apparatus for forming fine continuous filaments, particularly for producing nonwoven webs. The system uses a quench chamber and an impingement slot to draw and cool the filaments, allowing for high-speed spinning and improved web uniformity. The invention solves problems associated with conventional nonwoven spun bond systems, including spinning speed limitations, energy consumption, and machine element cleanliness. The method and apparatus can be used to produce a wide range of nonwoven materials with varying properties and applications.

<summary>
The sewing machine 1 is a computer-controlled sewing machine that allows users to specify a sewing position on a work cloth using an ultrasonic pen 91. The ultrasonic pen 91 transmits an ultrasonic wave when the pen tip 911 comes into contact with the work cloth, and the sewing machine 1 detects the wave using receivers 94 and 95. The sewing machine 1 calculates the position of the ultrasonic pen 91 based on the detected wave and performs sewing at the specified position. The receivers 94 and 95 are positioned on the sewing machine 1 to satisfy certain conditions, such as being separated from each other and being above the work cloth, to ensure accurate detection of the ultrasonic wave. The sewing machine 1 uses the calculated position to control the sewing process, including moving the work cloth and adjusting the sewing needle. The user can input commands and select patterns using a touch panel 26 on the sewing machine 1. The sewing machine 1 can store various sewing patterns and programs in its memory and can be connected to an external storage device.

<summary>
The invention relates to preparations for application onto cellulosic fabric materials to enhance their utility. The preparations comprise a blended mixture of wool particles or wool powder and a binding agent, with functional additives carried by the wool particles. The wool particles are preferably of macrofibril size or below, and can carry functional additives such as ultraviolet protection, anti-bacterial, or odor-absorbing agents. The invention also provides methods for preparing the preparations, including pulverizing wool fibers into ultrafine powder and adding functional additives. The preparations can be applied to fabric materials using various methods, including printing, padding, or foam application. The treated fabrics exhibit improved properties such as ultraviolet protection, wicking, and wrinkle recovery. The invention also provides for the use of ultrafine bamboo powder as a functional additive, which can improve moisture management properties of fabrics. The treated fabrics can be used to make various textile articles, including clothing and upholstery. The invention offers a sustainable and environmentally friendly solution for enhancing the utility of cellulosic fabric materials.

<summary>
The invention is an automatic quilting machine that uses two separate computers to control the sewing machine function and the quilting table movement, allowing for independent reprogramming of each function. The machine uses a computer-aided design program to create and modify patterns, which are then sewn into fabric using a sewing machine head mounted on a cross beam. The quilting table can move in the X and Y directions to accommodate large fabrics, and the machine can be programmed to sew complex patterns and designs.

<summary>
The present invention relates to a method of making a two-sided nonwoven fabric with a three-dimensional image. The fabric is formed by hydroentangling a layered precursor web comprising a first fibrous matrix, a second fibrous matrix, and a median support layer or scrim. The support layer acts as a fiber distribution control layer, preventing excessive intermingling of the fibrous matrices. The fabric is then imaged on a three-dimensional image transfer device, resulting in a durable and pronounced image. The fabric can be used in various applications, including home cleaning, personal hygiene, medical, and apparel construction. The invention provides a nonwoven fabric with improved properties, such as softness, durability, and resistance to elongation.

<summary>
The invention is a device for feeding a strip of material into a sewing machine and sewing it onto a cut of fabric, which ensures continuous operation and allows for the use of relatively stiff strips of material. The device features a stop that can be moved into the feed path of the strip, contacted by the strip, and retracted from the feed path, controlling the switching functions of the sewing machine and allowing for precise positioning of the strip.

<summary>
The invention relates to a knitting method and fabric for linking two tape-shaped knit pieces, such as those used in sweater collars or tank top neck ropes, by overlaying and binding off symmetrical loops using a flat knitting machine with movable needle beds. The method allows for the seamless connection of two knit pieces without the need for separate sewing or linking processes, improving productivity and product quality.

<summary>
The invention relates to a flexible traction element, a production line, and a method for producing the traction element, which consists of stranded cables sheathed in a flexible thermoplastic material. The production line includes a reel for unwinding the stranded cables, a device for precise orientation, a heater, an extruder, a cooling trough, and a storage roller. The method involves degreasing and preheating the stranded cables, then sheathing them with the thermoplastic material using the extruder. The production line and method allow for precise control of the spacing of the stranded cables and the thickness of the thermoplastic material, resulting in a high-quality traction element. The traction element is suitable for use in lifts and other applications where high tensile strength and flexibility are required. The invention improves the adhesion between the stranded cables and the thermoplastic material, resulting in a longer-lasting and more reliable traction element.

<summary>
The invention relates to a rotary hook arrangement for a lockstitch sewing machine, which provides a new and useful design for preventing co-rotation and reverse rotation of the bobbin housing. The holding means are arranged on the loop cast-off side of the bobbin housing, allowing the needle thread loop to expand unhindered until its maximum expansion is reached. The invention eliminates impediments to thread movement, reducing needle thread tension and providing a jerk-free and low-friction motion of the needle thread loop. The design is simple, rugged, and economical to manufacture, and can be used with or without a capsule release device.

<summary>
The invention relates to methods for producing silicon-based nanowires and materials using four-component and five-component liquid silane inks. The inks are formed by combining a liquid silane, a polymer, an accelerant, and a solvent, with the optional addition of a solid phase in the five-component ink. The inks are then electrospun to form fibers, which are transformed into silicon-containing materials through thermal or laser processing. The resulting materials can be used in various applications, including as anodes in lithium-ion batteries. The invention provides a continuous and scalable method for producing high-quality silicon-based nanowires and materials.

<summary>
The invention relates to a thread tension control system for a spool creel with multiple spool holders, each having a brake rotor and an adjustable braking element. The system uses a fluid pressure-sensitive biasing arrangement to influence the tensioning lever, allowing for centralized control of thread tension for the entire creel. The biasing arrangement can be set to different pressures to achieve different thread tensions, and can also be used to rapidly brake the spools when the warping machine is shut off. The system provides improved tension control and allows for individual control of thread tension for each spool holder.

<summary>
The present invention relates to a sewing machine detector that detects the position of a sewing needle and the speed of the sewing machine, and is designed to overcome the disadvantages of conventional detectors, such as vibration and noise interference. The detector features a compact and durable design with flat, sheet-shaped light shielding discs and linear optical fibers that reduce stress and improve accuracy, and also includes a power indicating cable that does not interfere with sewing machine control circuitry.

<summary>The invention describes a simplified process for the continuous production of viscose rayon yarns with a high degree of whiteness, involving completion of coagulation, washing with water having a non-alkaline pH, and drying, without the need for additional treatments. The process reduces the number of treatment steps and space requirements, while producing yarns with improved whiteness and mechanical properties.</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a deaeration tank for removing oxygen from pulp after oxygen bleaching. The tank has a small diameter and height, with an inlet pipe, outlet, and tangential swirl inducing inlet pipe that provide optimum deaeration. The swirl inducing fluid is the filtrate from the washer after the oxygen bleach. The tank is designed to be placed on top of an oxygen reactor and has no moving parts, allowing for steam or oxygen recovery. The deaeration process involves splashing the pulp against the side of the tank and swirling it with filtrate to remove oxygen. The tank's design and operation enable efficient deaeration of pulp before washing, improving the washing process and reducing foam formation.

<summary>
The invention relates to biomimetic tendon-reinforced (BTR) composite materials with improved properties, including high out-plane stiffness and strength-to-weight ratio. The BTR composite structure consists of stuffer members, tendon elements, and panels, which can be arranged in various configurations, including flat, curved, and spherical shapes. The tendon elements can be made of carbon fibers, nylon, Kevlar, or other materials, and the stuffer members can be solid, hollow, or semi-rigid. The BTR composite can be used in various applications, including aerospace, automotive, and marine industries. The invention also provides a methodology for designing and optimizing the BTR composite structure using function-oriented material design (FOMD) and topology optimization techniques. The FOMD approach allows for the design of materials with specific functions, such as supporting static loads, dissipating vibration energy, or absorbing impact energy. The BTR composite has potential applications in various fields, including composite armor, energy absorption, and structural components.

<summary>
The invention relates to a load-limiting device for braced frames that can dissipate energy during dynamic events such as earthquakes. The device is designed to undergo plastic deformation to absorb energy and limit the loads transmitted to the structure, thereby preventing damage. The device can be easily removed and replaced after a dynamic event, and its design allows for various shapes and sizes to accommodate different structural applications. The load-limiting device can be used in buildings, bridges, and other structures to reduce the risk of damage and collapse during seismic events.

<summary>

The present invention relates to a unit type bedroom cabinet designed for a flophouse facility, providing a private space for individuals. The cabinet has a floor area equal to a bed, a height allowing users to sit up, and a completely enclosed circumference except for a doorway. The invention aims to overcome the disadvantages of conventional bedroom cabinets, such as reduced dwelling area and poor sound-proofing. The bedroom cabinet of the present invention has a dual construction, comprising an outer casing and an inner casing, which provides excellent mechanical strength. The clearance between the outer and inner casings can be used to form boxes for electric devices or shelves for user belongings, without protruding into the dwelling area. The external surfaces of the cabinet are flat, allowing multiple cabinets to be stacked or installed adjacent to each other. The invention also provides for natural ventilation and sound-proofing through the use of venting grooves and spacers. The bedroom cabinet can be assembled and installed easily, and wiring work can be achieved easily from the outside. The invention provides two embodiments, with the second embodiment featuring a clearance over the entire portion between the outer casings and the inner casing, with spacer members interposed to provide ventilation and sound-proofing. The spacer members can be designed to have different strengths depending on their position and load-bearing requirements.

</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a portable, temporary guard rail support for use in constructing safety barriers at sites under construction, such as office buildings and high-rise apartments. The guard rail support consists of a base plate, upright column, rail supporting brackets, kick board retaining flange, angular brace, and safety tie-off ring. The support can be secured to a floor or ground surface using fasteners, and can be used to construct a safety barrier with upper and lower wooden rails and a kick board. The invention also includes a concrete-filled steel base for added stability and support. The guard rail support is designed to be easy to install and remove, and can be reused multiple times. The invention provides a safe and efficient way to construct safety barriers at construction sites, and can be used in a variety of applications beyond just floor slab construction.

<summary>

The invention relates to a method and apparatus for stimulating crude oil reservoirs to enhance oil production using a combination of pulsed power electrohydraulic and electromagnetic methods. The invention builds upon the teachings of U.S. Pat. No. 4,345,650 issued to Wesley, which discloses a device for electrohydraulic recovery of crude oil. The present invention uses a coupled process of direct electrohydraulic acoustic vibrations and electromagnetically-induced high-frequency acoustic vibrations to stimulate oil production. The electrohydraulic acoustic pulse travels at a finite speed from the well where the pulse originates, while the electromagnetically-induced vibrations occur for a short time after the pulse is initiated. The invention can be applied using a multi-level discharge device that allows sequential firing of several sources in one well, extending the effective range of the technique. The discharge characteristics of the pulse sources can be customized to produce specific frequencies that will achieve optimal stimulation by activating specific scales of inclusions in the reservoir. The invention also includes the use of electromagnetic pulse sources that do not generate a direct acoustic shock pulse, allowing for use in more sensitive wells. The tool can be directed using a range of directional focusing and shaping devices to aim the pulses at specific portions of the formation. The invention also includes improvements to the electrodes designed for electrohydraulic stimulation, such as improved alloys and gas injection through a hollow electrode.

</summary>

<summary>
The disclosure relates to a splice for extending the length of a soil reinforcing element used in Mechanically Stabilized Earth (MSE) structures, allowing for longer lengths to be achieved without manufacturing or transporting excessively long elements. The splice uses wave plates with transverse protrusions to seat transverse wires from the soil reinforcing element and a grid-strip, which are then secured together using connective devices to prevent longitudinal escape.

<summary>
The invention relates to a plow blade with a fluid passage and points of fluid ejection, designed to reduce the power required to pull the plow through the ground. The plow blade has a blade, leading edge sections, and a fluid tube that provides a flow path for fluid to exit the blade at controlled locations and with a controlled flow rate. The fluid tube can be extended to terminate at a position near the bottom of the blade, where the fluid pressure is highest, to maximize fluid ejection in the critical high friction area. The leading edge sections can be attached to the blade with stitch welds, and the number and location of the welds can be varied to tailor the plow for specific applications. The invention also includes a manifold that can be installed between the blade and the leading edge sections, allowing for easy modification of the fluid injection characteristics. The plow blade can be manufactured using traditional processes and can be easily tailored to match specific job requirements.

<summary>
The invention relates to a building system, specifically a stucco type cavity wall construction technique that allows for larger panels without movement control joints. The system includes a frame or substructure, battens, multiple layers of mesh, and a plaster matrix applied in multiple layers. The invention also includes various aspects of the building structure, such as flashing members, side jamb assemblies, and head flashed window or door assemblies. The system is designed to meet New Zealand building codes and regulations, including NZS3604 and NZS4251.

<summary>
The invention describes a safe construction with a door and locking mechanism designed to provide secure storage of valuable items, featuring a unique door engagement system with grooves and bar members that prevent lateral movement and protect the lock from prying. The safe can be constructed in place using concrete and rebars, or preassembled at a factory, and offers a simple yet effective design for secure storage.

<summary>
The invention relates to a system for measuring fluid pressures in geological formations, particularly in low permeability formations. The system involves cementing a conduit with a filter at its bottom end in a borehole, and then pumping a fluid through the conduit to displace the cement grout and create a fluid connection to the formation. The pressure sensor is connected to the conduit and measures the pressure of the formation fluid. The system can be used to measure pressures in various types of formations, including groundwater and petroleum reservoirs. The invention provides a more accurate and reliable method for measuring formation pressures, which is important for various applications such as groundwater monitoring and petroleum exploration.

<summary>
The invention relates to a jointing structure in vehicle traveling path joints with an expansion function, particularly for new transit systems, monorails, and road bridges. The structure consists of multiple steps with an expansion gap, elastic members mounted inside the steps, and a joint block mounted on the elastic members across the expansion gap. The elastic members are designed to deform horizontally to absorb bridge girder expansion or contraction caused by temperature changes. The joint block and supporting blocks are made of the same concrete as the traveling path and are fitted detachably to facilitate maintenance. The structure prevents tire fall-in and stuck-in situations, ensures high slip resistance, and is adaptable to various tire configurations. The invention also provides a method of mounting an elastic member that is easy to install and maintain.

<summary>
The invention relates to a floor track system for use in a fluid treatment chamber, particularly for chilling cooked meat products. The system prevents the wheels of hand trucks from contaminating the treatment fluid, allowing for the reuse of the fluid without decontamination. The track system includes a wheel channel with opposed sidewalls, one of which extends upwardly more than the other, and a cover plate that overlies the top of the channel. The cover plate is hinged to facilitate cleaning and prevents fluid from entering the channel. An alternative embodiment uses inflatable elastomer seals to enclose the wheel channel and prevent fluid entry. The system is designed for use in a sanitary environment and allows for the quick and versatile transportation of meat products. The invention solves the problem of contamination of the treatment fluid by the hand truck wheels, allowing for the reuse of the fluid and reducing waste. The system is adaptable for use in various industries beyond meat processing.

<summary>
The invention relates to a lock device for a work machine, specifically a backhoe, that prevents the boom from tilting or falling due to vibration or loss of pressure oil. The lock device consists of an engaging member and an engaged member that can be easily operated manually, and features a guide member that keeps the engaging member at a prescribed position, ensuring stable and secure locking and releasing of the boom.

<summary>
The invention relates to a swimming pool vacuum cleaning device with a flexible platform that allows for adjustable suction efficiency during cleaning. The device features a central suction portion that can be raised or lowered relative to the pool bottom to regulate suction, and adjustment mechanisms are conveniently located on top of the suction head. The invention also includes a kit form of the adjustment mechanism that can be added to existing pool cleaning devices with minimal modification. The device allows for precise regulation of suction without adjusting the suction source, making it useful for commercial pool cleaning operators who need to clean multiple pools with varying suction capabilities.

<summary>
The invention relates to an apparatus for retrieving a wear bushing from a well head and casing, comprising a sub-unit with a mandrel and a retriever section that can slide along the mandrel and engage with the wear bushing. The retriever section has protruding members that align with slots in the wear bushing, allowing it to be retrieved without damaging the bushing or the apparatus. The invention allows for vertical play of the retriever section, preventing damage from the weight of the drill string, and can be used to retrieve wear bushings of different types.

<summary>

The invention relates to a downhole vibratory tool that allows passage of a wireline or other tools through its central passage. The tool has a modular design with stacked pistons that increase the power delivery per stroke. A removable plug is dropped into the passage to initiate vibratory operation. The dump valve is annularly shaped, eliminating the need for a central seat, and opens and closes without slamming against a seat. The tool can be operated to deliver high-amplitude, low-frequency oscillating forces without impacts or with impacts on each cycle. The design allows for longer power strokes and more reliable operation. The tool can be used for various applications, including fishing and stimulation operations. The modular design enables the tool to be customized for specific requirements. The invention eliminates the need for a dart assembly, reducing complexity and cost. The tool can be operated with or without impacts, and its design reduces wear and fatigue on moving parts.

</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a precast concrete retaining wall system with a face panel and a base, where the face panel has an integral counterfort that extends from the rear side of the panel. The counterfort provides additional support and stability to the wall, and can have openings for drainage. The face panel and base are connected using rebars and grout, eliminating the need for temporary shoring. The system allows for taller walls and shorter bases, and can be customized to fit different site conditions. The invention also discloses various embodiments, including the use of H-piles for added stability, and the integration of vehicle impact barriers. The system is designed to be flexible and adaptable to different site conditions and requirements. The invention provides a cost-effective and efficient solution for constructing retaining walls.

<summary>
The present invention relates to a down hole heating system for oil and gas wells to improve production by heating oil and paraffin to reduce viscosity and blockage. The system includes a heating unit with electrical resistance type heater rods, heat insulating packer, and stainless steel tubing collar to focus heat in the production zone. The heating unit is designed to overcome common problems of prior art heating units, including unit invasion by down hole fluids and electrical shorts, by using a cement block and steel fitting assembly to shield electrical connections. The system and method of use are designed to increase flow rates in oil and gas wells by heating the production formation itself, rather than just the oil in the production tubing.

<summary>
The invention relates to a downhole tool for conducting mechanical activities in wells, specifically a mechanism for installing and removing objects in wells, including stuck or lost objects. The tool features an outer tubular body and an inner body structure that can move telescopically to grip or release an object. The inner body structure has a locking mandrel with a catch mechanism that can be locked or unlocked by moving the inner and outer bodies relative to each other. The catch mechanism uses guide pins and springs to control the locking and unlocking process. The tool can be used for various downhole operations, including fishing for stuck or lost objects. The invention provides a simple and efficient way to connect and disconnect the tool from the object, without the need for jarring or violent movements. The tool can be used multiple times without needing to be removed from the well bore for resetting. The invention is suitable for a wide range of downhole service operations, including installation and removal of downhole tools and fishing operations. The tool can be designed in different forms, including an overshot type and an internal spear type, to accommodate different types of objects and well bore conditions.

<summary>

The present invention relates to modular composed stave floors, particularly to a method for manufacturing them. Conventional composed stave floors have drawbacks such as thin sight substrates that can deform or detach, and long cure times for the glue. The invention aims to preserve the physical, aesthetic, and functional properties of the sight substrate and provide a longer lifespan for the floor. The method involves providing a sight substrate with a thickness of at least 4 mm and a base substrate with a thickness of at least 12 mm, and assembling them together with glue and multidirectional holding means. The holding means include dendrites, adhesion, and horizontal and vertical reinforcement means. The invention allows for corrective maintenance and provides improved durability. The sight substrate can be made from decorative or functional wood, cut in various forms to maintain its natural properties. The invention eliminates the need for glazing during installation, and the glaze can be applied by the supplier. The composed stave floor of the invention does not exhibit deformation or detachment and can be maintained to regain its original properties.

</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a ladder attachment that improves the lateral stability of the ladder, prevents it from slipping or sliding, and allows it to straddle corners without losing stability. The attachment features a brace assembly with a resilient pad that grips the work surface without damaging it, increasing the contact area and providing a non-slip grip. The invention is designed to overcome the problems of typical ladders, which can damage work surfaces and are unstable when used on corners.

<summary>
The invention relates to a collated nail strip with a plastic material molded onto and adhered to the nails, which reduces debris generation during driving. The plastic material is formulated from an adhesive polymer, such as a maleic anhydride modified polypropylene, and is molded onto preheated nails to enhance adhesion. The collation system includes a collar portion that captures the nail shank and a connecting portion that extends between adjacent collar portions. The connecting portion can be designed with a bridge and rib structure to provide rigidity and facilitate separation of the nail from the strip. The nail strip can be configured to influence separation of the nail from the strip at a desired location, reducing debris generation. The invention also provides for a tapered collar portion to facilitate penetration into the wood. The nail strip exhibits improved holding power and reduced debris generation compared to prior art collations.

<summary>
The invention relates to a nozzle for applying sealants, such as silicones, in various industries like aviation, automotive, naval, railway, and robotics. The nozzle has a bell-shaped tip and an injection button with a special design that allows for precise sealing operations. The nozzle can be connected to a cartridge or injection machine and is designed for use in both manual and automated applications. The bell-shaped tip is designed to encapsulate rivets or nuts, and the injection button has channels and orifices that direct the flow of sealing material. The nozzle can be used to apply sealants in various ways, including to chamfers and orifices. The invention provides a device that simplifies the sealing process, reduces application time, and increases the quality of the resulting sealant application. The nozzle is preferably made of plastic, and the injection button can be easily removed and replaced. The invention is an improvement over existing nozzles, which are often made of metal and require solvents for cleaning.

<summary>
The invention relates to a position sensor that generates an electrical signal proportional to the distance between a moving object and a fixed position, and a method of multiplexing multiple sensors on a minimum number of wires with a minimum of energy required from each sensor monitoring system. The sensor includes a waveform generator and an error correction generator that modifies the sensing signal to remove unwanted power and provide a conditioned sensing signal to a remote monitor via two wires. The error correction generator eliminates strong static signals and error signals that do not deliver information about the position of the object being sensed, allowing for efficient and accurate monitoring.

<summary>
The invention relates to a valve actuation system for internal combustion engines, which provides a desmodromic, essentially springless, and infinitely variable valve actuation system that can be precisely controlled to present the most advantageous configuration of valving, including any percentage port opening on the intake cycle to closure of the intake port. The system uses a camshaft and a translating means to reciprocate a slide, which in turn opens and closes the valve, and a rotatable link to control the valve displacement. The system can be controlled by an actuator, electromechanical or hydraulic, to achieve variable valve displacement and timing, allowing for improved engine performance and fuel efficiency.

<summary>
The invention relates to aquarium lighting using LEDs, specifically a light member with a housing and a lighting control region that includes control channels for controlling different colors of light, and modules that can be coupled to the control channels to emit specific colors of light. The light member can be used in various applications, including aquariums and underneath cabinets, and can be controlled using timers, switches, and remote controls.

<summary>

The present invention relates to a cooled flow deflection apparatus for a fluid-flow machine, particularly a gas turbine, which operates at high temperatures. The apparatus has a cooled stator blade or rotor blade with internal cooling channels and separating walls that bound the channels. The separating walls are typically cast together with the blade, but this approach has several disadvantages, including increased heat transfer, thermal stresses, and high blade weight. The invention proposes to construct the separating walls as separate inserts that are inserted into the apparatus and secured there, which avoids the disadvantages of the prior art. The inserts can be made of metal or non-metal materials and can be easily replaced or adjusted to vary the deflection radius or introduce connecting cross sections between cooling channels. The invention simplifies production, reduces blade weight, and improves cooling efficiency. The inserts can be secured by an integral material joint, such as soldering or welding, and can be designed in various shapes, including straight or U-shaped. The invention is particularly advantageous for rotor blades that rotate at high speed. The approach can also be applied to existing blades by removing the cast separating walls and inserting new ones.

</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a system and method for controlling a fuel delivery system in a vehicle, which can be switched between automatic and manual control, allowing the vehicle to operate safely and efficiently in various conditions. The system uses a control unit, sensors, and motors to control the throttle valve, and can be used in conjunction with a continuously variable transmission to optimize vehicle performance.

<summary>

The invention is a waste fuel burner that efficiently burns wood waste and other combustible materials while minimizing particulate emissions. The burner has a primary combustion chamber where fuel is gasified and a secondary combustion chamber where complete combustion occurs. The primary chamber uses preheated underfire air to dry and gasify the fuel, and swirl air is introduced tangentially to separate particulate matter from the volatile gases. The volatile gases then enter the secondary chamber where additional combustion air is introduced to complete combustion. The burner is designed to operate at low excess air levels, reducing waste and increasing efficiency. The invention can burn fuels with high moisture content and produces a clean exhaust gas that can be used in boilers or other industrial applications. The burner is self-regulating and has a fast response time to changes in load, making it suitable for use in a variety of industries. The invention can also be used to burn dirty particulate-laden gases from other sources, such as coking operations. The burner's design and operation are controlled by a pneumatic control system that regulates air flow, fuel feed, and temperature. The invention offers several advantages over conventional waste fuel burners, including lower emissions, higher efficiency, and reduced maintenance.

</summary>

<summary>
The invention is an evaporative cooler system that uses a heat exchanger to cool air without adding moisture to it. The system draws in fresh air and return air from the room to be cooled, and uses the return air to evaporate water, which cools the heat exchanger. The cooled air is then distributed to the room. The system can be configured to recirculate some of the return air to mix with fresh air, or to bypass some of the cooled air to mix with the return air. A hybrid version of the system adds a vapor compression refrigeration unit to further cool a portion of the air stream. The system is more efficient and uses less power than traditional vapor compression refrigeration units. The invention can achieve a dry bulb temperature of 67.8°F with an efficiency of 90%.

<summary>
The document describes a fluid pump with multiple pump heads connected in series, allowing for high volumetric flow rate and high pressure. Each pump head has an impeller that moves fluid through multiple conduits, which combine into a single flow before exiting the pump head. The pump heads are connected by a drive structure that commonly drives the impellers. The pump can be mounted on a support structure, such as a wheeled boom, hitching assembly, or trailer, for operation at a fluid reservoir. The pump is suitable for pumping fluids, such as liquid manure, from a reservoir to a holding tank or for irrigation. The pump heads can be designed to accommodate different flow rates and pressures, and additional pump heads can be added to increase operating pressure. The pump's design allows for modularity and ease of assembly and maintenance. The pump can also be equipped with an agitator nozzle to mix the fluid in the reservoir.

<summary>
The invention relates to engine compression release brakes, particularly those used in engines with less than all cylinders. Traditional systems include a brake for each cylinder, but this invention reduces the number of components to improve engine robustness. The engine includes a housing with multiple cylinders, with a compression release brake attached to a portion of the cylinders, which is less than all of them. The brake is operably coupled to a cam-actuated exhaust valve and can be controlled by an electronic control module. The brake includes a solenoid, spool valve, and piston that work together to open the exhaust valve during the compression stroke, allowing compressed air to be vented and providing engine braking. The system can be modified to accommodate different engine sizes and braking horsepower requirements. The invention provides a modular compression release brake system that can be customized to meet specific application needs. This design allows customers to choose and pay for only the amount of braking horsepower they require.

<summary>
The invention relates to a mounting link between an engine structure and an attached structure, such as an auxiliary gearbox, designed to withstand extreme loads, including those caused by "blade-off" events. The link assembly includes a male link, a female link, and a pin that selectively retains the links, allowing for translation and radial interface damping in the event of extreme loads. The pin is designed to shear at a known load magnitude, allowing the links to translate and absorb the shock, thereby preventing damage to the gearbox and engine. The invention provides a solution to the problem of extreme loads on aircraft gas turbine engines and their attached peripherals.

<summary>
The invention relates to archery equipment, specifically apparatus and methods for attaching arrow points and nocks to arrow shafts and balancing arrow shafts. The invention provides a point cap system that is small, lightweight, and adjustable in weight, allowing for perfect balance, and also includes a balance pin whose weight can be adjusted to balance an arrow shaft. The invention also provides means for attaching points to arrow shafts without allowing dirt to enter the shaft, and is suited for use with unidirectional fiber reinforced shafts.

<summary>

The invention is an electronically controlled pyrotechnic sound and flash simulator for use with small arms training, providing a cost-effective and realistic simulation of small arms fire without modifying the weapon. The simulator uses a low-cost plastic expendable housing a metal/oxidizer pyrotechnic in conjunction with an electrical ignition system. The expendable contains multiple rounds and is installed in a firing unit that can be inserted into the weapon via the magazine breech. The simulator produces sound and flash by electrically igniting the pyrotechnic in a confined space and venting the combustion products through the weapon's ejection port. The electrical control circuit provides for automatic and semiautomatic fire and interfaces with the weapon trigger and bolt. The simulator is designed to provide a realistic simulation of small arms fire noise and flash, and is an inexpensive means to provide realistic training using an actual weapon. The simulator is also reliable, low maintenance, and reusable. The pyrotechnic simulation of small arms fire is achieved without dangerous pressurization of the ignition chamber. The simulator is packaged to resemble the magazine clip of the M16 rifle and can be used with a MILES unit attached to the weapon. The invention provides a safe and realistic way to train combat troops with small arms.

</summary>

<summary>

The present invention relates to an air intake device for an internal combustion engine that utilizes the dynamic effects of air flow to improve volumetric efficiency. The device comprises a tank, two pipes of different cross-sectional areas, and a valve that opens or closes in response to engine load. The valve is disposed in the larger pipe and is actuated by a vacuum diaphragm actuator. The device aims to improve engine performance while reducing air intake noise. The noise reduction is achieved by the provision of a narrow passage that constitutes a resonator, which absorbs the noise. The valve operation is controlled based on engine speed and load, and the optimal operating conditions are stored in a map in the control circuit. The device can be used in conjunction with a conventional air intake passage, air cleaner, and intake manifold. The invention provides improved engine performance and reduced noise levels. The valve operation is controlled to create a new compound curve comprising the peak portions of the volumetric efficiency curves.

</summary>

<summary>
The invention is a two-part bracket system for mounting speakers or other equipment to a pole, flat surface, or other structure. The system consists of a stationary bracket and an adjustable bracket that can be connected together to mount the equipment. The adjustable bracket can be attached to the equipment and then connected to the stationary bracket, which is mounted to the surface or pole. The system allows for easy adjustment of the equipment's position and can be used by one person. The stationary bracket can be mounted to a pole using a pole clamp assembly, which includes adapters and a chain to secure the bracket to the pole. The adjustable bracket can be rotated and locked into place using tabs and hooks, and then secured with screws. The system is suitable for mounting loudspeakers, lighting, signage, displays, monitors, video cameras, and other equipment. The invention provides a simple and effective way to mount equipment to a surface or pole, and can be used in a variety of applications.

<summary>

The disclosure relates to a combustion apparatus, specifically a burner that can be part of a system with interchangeable heat utilizing appliances. The burner is designed to be efficient and clean-burning, with a combustion chamber that allows for primary, secondary, and tertiary combustion. Air flows through the fuel holder to support initial combustion, and around the fuel holder to support secondary combustion. The burner has a shroud that provides a flow path for tertiary combustion air and keeps the exterior surface cool to the touch. The burner also has legs to elevate it above the ground and a pivotally coupled ash pan. A perforate food grate and cover are also pivotally coupled to the burner, allowing for easy access and closure. The burner can be coupled to various modular heat utilizing appliances, such as cookers, a food smoker, a space heater, and a pyrolyzer. The pyrolyzer can be used to pyrolyze carboniferous materials and recover vaporized liquid products. The burner can be used with a fuel feed feature to enable continuous operation. The design allows for efficient and clean combustion, with reduced emissions and fuel consumption.

</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a rotary internal combustion engine with a cooling system that improves fuel economy and durability. The engine has a housing with a circumferential cooling flow passageway and spark plug bosses that are staggered with respect to the direction of flow, allowing for separate flow paths for vapor release during boiling heat transfer. This design improves the distribution of coolant velocities around the boss surface, reducing locally high thermal conditions and increasing the heat transfer coefficient by at least 20%. The spark plug terminals are offset from the centerline of the trochoid wall, but still allow for a close in-line arrangement, and the bosses are arranged to prevent vapor binding films from forming. The invention provides a more uniform temperature gradient across the width of the gas side of the wall, reducing the risk of thermal distortion and structural failure.

<summary>
The invention relates to a method of minimizing flow disturbance caused by the closing and reopening of turbine control valves during periodic operational testing. The method uses control valve positions as feedback to maintain constant total mass flow through several parallel turbine inlet flow control valves, thereby minimizing steam boiler pressure changes or turbine power changes. The flow characteristic for each valve is determined during design and used to calculate the flow difference between the system with all valves open and the system with one valve closed. This difference is then applied to the total flow demand to each of the remaining valves to maintain constant total flow. The method has been tested and shown to reduce pressure excursion of the turbine inlet main steam pressure by 95%.

<summary>
The invention is a mixing valve for an aircraft cleaning apparatus that allows for continuous analog control of the proportional quantities of two fluids, such as soap solution and water, emerging from an outlet passage, ranging from 0% to 100% of each fluid. The valve system is designed to maintain constant fluid pressures at the inlet passages, allowing multiple identical valve systems to operate from a common soap solution source and common water source without adverse effects.

<summary>
The invention relates to a method and arrangement for compressing gas in a compressor station for a gas pipeline, particularly in permanent frost areas. The method involves compressing the gas to a higher pressure, cooling it, and then expanding it to the desired exit pressure and temperature. The expansion step cools the gas further, eliminating the need for separate re-cooling units. The arrangement includes compressors, heat exchangers, and expansion turbines, which are controlled by an electronic control system. The compressors are arranged in two primary compression stages and an additional compression stage, with the expansion turbines recovering drive energy. The method and arrangement reduce investment costs and operation risks compared to conventional re-cooling technology. The invention is particularly useful for long-distance gas pipelines in permanent frost areas. The compressor station can be operated differently during winter and summer months to optimize performance. The invention provides a more efficient and cost-effective solution for gas compression and cooling in compressor stations.

<summary>
The document describes a system for mounting a cooling fan to an enclosure without using fasteners, which is commonly used in applications where forced air movement is necessary for cooling. The system uses a motor carrier with mounting legs that have resilient leg portions and a compression gap, which are inserted into recessed portions on the panel and secured by spring members. The installation process involves compressing the spring members and rotating the mounting legs to secure them in place, preventing vibrational noise and ensuring a stable connection. The system is applicable in various industries, including automotive, computer, and electronic instrumentation, where forced air cooling is necessary.

<summary>
The invention relates to kinematic mounts used to support precision instruments in spacecraft, which require advanced lightweight and stiff composite materials to meet weight efficiency requirements. However, these materials have low damping characteristics, leading to high vibration levels that can compromise instrument functionality. Conventional kinematic mounts have limited success in reducing vibration, and there is a need for additional vibration reduction techniques. The present invention provides kinematic mounts with novel damping features, including a passive energy dissipating mechanism to protect instruments from flight loads. The mounts incorporate vibration damping materials at machined hinge or flexure locations, which introduce a damping mechanism into the six mount suspension modes. The damping mechanism can be designed to dissipate vibration energy in the form of heat, reducing the loads transmitted to the instrument. The invention provides a kinematic mounting scheme that uses six identical strut elements, which can be arranged to approximately uncouple the mount suspension modes, further improving performance. The invention achieves modal damping values of 5-17% of critical damping, which is at least one to two orders of magnitude greater than existing designs.

<summary>
The invention is a large size oil shear type clutch unit designed for high horsepower applications, such as an aircraft catapult system, which minimizes residual drag and provides improved cooling and torque control. The clutch unit features a novel piston and cylinder arrangement that applies strong coupling forces between clutch plates and discs, and allows for easy replacement of individual clutch disc segments without disassembling the entire unit. The unit also utilizes a servo control valve and fluid amplifiers to precisely control the fluid pressure and flow rate to the clutch plates and discs, ensuring smooth and efficient operation.

<summary>
The invention describes a novel internal combustion engine design that captures and utilizes waste heat energy to increase efficiency and reduce emissions. The engine features a combination of combustion cylinders and expansion cylinders, with water injection and cascading expansion to maximize thermal-to-mechanical energy conversion. The design aims to eliminate the need for a radiator and achieve high thermal efficiency, with potential applications in vehicles and other systems.

<summary>
The invention relates to the fabrication of coated steel plates intended for welding and heat treatment to produce parts with good mechanical characteristics and corrosion resistance. The plates have a steel substrate and a precoat consisting of an intermetallic alloy layer topped by a metal alloy layer. A portion of the metal alloy layer is removed at the periphery of the plate to prevent the formation of harmful intermetallic areas during welding. The removal of the metal alloy layer can be done by brushing or laser ablation. The width of the removed area is adjusted to ensure that no metal coating is introduced into the molten metal during welding and to provide corrosion resistance after heat treatment. The plates are then welded and heat-treated to form a surface intermetallic alloy compound that prevents oxidation and decarburization of the underlying steel. The part is then cooled to confer the target mechanical characteristics, such as a martensitic, bainitic, or bainitic-martensitic microstructure. The invention provides a method for fabricating parts with good mechanical properties and corrosion resistance, suitable for use in the automotive industry.

<summary>
The present invention relates to a remote control system for a mobile energy recovery structure that extracts energy from severe weather patterns. The system includes a central service facility, a mobile structure, and a communication system that enables remote control and data acquisition. The mobile structure is equipped with sensors and control circuits that communicate with a microprocessor system, which in turn communicates with the central service facility via a wireless communication system. The central service facility receives weather data from various sources, including weather satellites, and uses this data to optimize the mobile structure's navigation and energy extraction. A graphical user interface at the central service facility allows human operators to monitor and control the mobile structure's operation. The system can be used for various types of mobile structures, including sailing vessels and propelled vessels, and can be adapted for different types of energy extraction, such as wind, wave, or hydrokinetic energy. The system's algorithm takes into account various factors, including weather patterns, vessel performance, and physical object detection, to optimize energy extraction and ensure safe operation.

<summary>
The invention relates to a rolling body guide cage produced from a ring element composed of multiple flat material ring segments joined together in succession in the circumferential direction. The ring segments are welded together in a forming step that precedes the formation of the axial profiling, reducing production costs and waste material. The ring element is formed from sheet metal material and has an axial profiling formed by forming techniques, with several rolling body guide structures arranged in succession in the circumferential direction. The invention is suitable for the manufacture of radial bearing cages and axial bearing cages, including groove and angular ball bearings.

<summary>

The document describes a system and method for providing customer service in a telecommunications network. The system uses global satellite positioning to facilitate processing and transmission of information associated with customer service locations. A service technician visits a customer service location and uses an input device to request coordinates associated with the location. The coordinates are obtained through a global positioning satellite system and stored in a database. The system also includes a dispatch system, address guide system, and customer record system to manage and update customer information. The system can provide driving directions for a service technician to travel from one customer service location to another. The system aims to improve customer service response time and reduce errors in locating customer service locations. The system can be used to verify customer addresses and update customer records. The system includes various components, such as servers, databases, and software applications, to facilitate the processing and transmission of information. The system can be implemented using various technologies, including wireless networks, landline servers, and computer-readable media.

</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields, particularly magnetic fields, using two real triaxial magnetic field sensors, three pairs of compensation coils, and a control unit. The system can compensate for both homogeneous and inhomogeneous magnetic fields. The control unit processes the output signals from the two real sensors to generate virtual sensor signals, which are then used to control the compensation coils. The system can be used to protect an object from the effects of an interfering field, and can also be used in conjunction with another identical system to protect two objects placed side by side. The control unit can take into account feedback effects between the two systems when they are operated in close proximity. The system can be used in applications such as scanning electron microscopes (SEM) and can compensate for gradient fields. The control algorithm used by the system can be linear or nonlinear and can be adjusted to suit different control tasks.

<summary>
The invention relates to a method for investigating a sample derived from a biological source using Coherent Anti-Stokes Raman Scattering (CARS) microscopy. The method involves furnishing at least one resonance site in the sample through a bioorthogonal reaction with a reaction partner, which allows for the detection of specific chemical structures in the sample. The bioorthogonal reaction is a chemical reaction that can occur in living systems without interfering with natural processes. The reaction partner can be introduced into the sample and reacts with an intrinsic chemical structure to form a resonance site, which can then be detected using CARS microscopy. The method allows for the detection of specific chemical structures in the sample, even if they do not inherently possess resonance sites. The invention also enables the introduction of a defined background signal, which can improve the reproducibility of CARS microscopy. The method can be used in various applications, including biomedical research and diagnostics.

<summary>
The invention is a system for assessing the quality of segmentations in radiation therapy, which compares two or more electronic segmentation files to evaluate the conformance of the segmentations and provides a metric score based on the comparison. The system can be used for training clinicians, quality assurance testing of auto-segmentation routines, and assessing changes in patient anatomy during radiation therapy.

<summary>
The invention relates to a method and apparatus for accelerating the execution of floating point operations, specifically the effective subtraction operation. The effective subtraction operation is a complex process that involves aligning fractions, subtracting, and normalizing the result. The invention accelerates this process by determining a difference between a subset of signals of the operand exponent arguments and using this difference to begin the subtraction operation before the complete difference between the exponent arguments is available. This allows the final fraction result to be calculated more quickly, as the correct result is either the result of the subtraction or one of the original operand fractions. The invention is implemented using a specific apparatus and logic units that perform the necessary calculations and selections to produce the final fraction result.

<summary>
The invention relates to a method and system for tracking and managing patient specimens, particularly in a hospital setting. The system uses machine-readable codes, such as barcodes, to identify patients, specimens, and medical staff, and to track the collection and processing of specimens. The system aims to eliminate errors in specimen labeling and tracking, which can have serious consequences for patient care. The method involves assigning unique barcodes to patients, specimens, and medical staff, and using these barcodes to track the collection and processing of specimens. The system uses a computer and barcode reader to store and retrieve information about the specimens and to ensure that specimens are properly labeled and tracked. The invention has the potential to improve patient safety and reduce costs associated with specimen labeling and tracking. The system can be implemented in a variety of settings, including hospitals, clinics, and laboratories.

<summary>
The invention is a voice-activated distance measuring device that provides golfers with information such as distance to the pin, green size, and pin placement. The device uses GPS technology and voice recognition software to respond to voice commands and provide audible output through a speaker or headphone. The device can be incorporated into a hat or visor and includes a bone conductance vibration sensor to detect voice commands. The device can also accept verbal input to memorize and compute golf strategy, club selection, and other golf-related data. Additionally, the device can be connected to a computer to upload and download data, and can be used for other applications such as hiking, surveying, and scuba diving. The device can also be used to provide pre-recorded golf instructions and can be expanded to include other features such as Bluetooth connectivity. The device is designed to be user-friendly and can be used by golfers of all skill levels.

<summary>
The present invention relates to a design rule checking system and method for integrated circuits that accurately reports errors for different regions, such as logic and memory. The method applies the right set of rules to the right regions of the mask pattern data, eliminating false errors and ensuring accurate design rule checks. Customized design rules are created for each type of region by modifying standard logic rules to reflect the needs of particular regions. The system uses a computer program to check the design rules and categorize errors by region, such as logic, memory, and other types of circuitry. The invention is particularly useful for system-on-chip integrated circuits that use a mix of logic and memory circuitry. The method is more efficient and reliable than prior art techniques, and can be applied to other industries such as liquid crystal display manufacturing.

<summary>
This invention describes the use of thin substrate waveguide holograms as illuminators for objects with specific illumination requirements, such as display holograms or spatial light modulators, providing controlled and efficient illumination with high diffraction efficiency and minimal stray light. The waveguide hologram illuminator can be designed to overcome limitations of conventional illumination systems, including space constraints, alignment difficulties, and spectral filtering requirements.

<summary>
The invention relates to a method and apparatus for testing dynamoelectric machine rotors, specifically squirrel cage rotors for induction motors. The apparatus includes a test head with a core, primary windings, and voltage and skew sensing pick-up coils. The test head is designed to magnetize the rotor and sense the resulting magnetic flux to determine the rotor's resistance, reactance, and effective electrical skew. The apparatus also includes a data acquisition and processing system that samples the sense signals and calculates the desired values. The system can perform automatic pass/fail determinations based on predetermined threshold values. The apparatus can test rotors quickly and efficiently, with a dual fixture system allowing for simultaneous testing of two rotors. The test sequence involves retracting the rotor into the test head, rotating it, and sampling the sense signals during the rotation. The apparatus can store statistical data for multiple tests and provide a printed report of the results. The invention provides a novel and improved method and apparatus for non-destructive testing of dynamoelectric machine rotors.

<summary>
The document describes a system for securing a mobile device by controlling access to native resources and operating system methods. A managed library is granted access to native resources if it has a valid digital certificate, while a managed application is denied access if it lacks a certificate or attempts to access unauthorized resources. The system uses a manager to enforce security policies and prevent malicious code from accessing sensitive areas of the device. The manager checks digital certificates and verifies the authenticity of code before allowing it to execute. The system also uses a runtime host to access native functions of the operating system, and the runtime host is validated through a digital signature. This approach allows for secure execution of third-party applications on a mobile device while protecting the device's native resources and operating system.

<summary>
The invention relates to an improved identification card with an internal antenna and integrated circuit chip protected by two shock-absorbing layers and encased in rigid outer layers. The card is made by laminating the chip and antenna between two layers of silica-filled polyolefin, and then sandwiching these layers between two transparent polymer layers. The polymer layers are then laminated to protect the card and allow for the printing of variable indicia. The card can be personalized using dye diffusion thermal transfer or inkjet printing. The invention provides a durable and easily manufactured identification card that protects the electronic components from damage. The card can include additional security features, such as low cohesivity layers, security inks, or optically variable inks.

<summary>
The invention relates to the implementation of a memory, specifically a First-In-First-Out (FIFO) queue, in a functional memory environment. The queue is implemented using a tree-shaped data structure, where nodes have a maximum size and additions and deletions are made in a way that maintains a balanced tree. The tree structure allows for efficient updates, with a time and space complexity that is logarithmically dependent on the length of the queue. A header node can be added to the structure to improve performance and allow for faster updates. The header node can also include a bit that indicates the direction of the queue, allowing for easy inversion of the queue. The invention can be used to implement a double-ended queue (deque) and can be modified to accommodate different node sizes and patterns. The memory arrangement includes a memory, intermediate registers, and control logic to maintain the queue. The invention provides a more efficient and space-saving way to implement a FIFO queue in a functional memory environment.

<summary>
The invention relates to electrically programmable read-only memory (EPROM) devices that can be manufactured using existing integrated circuit (IC) technologies. The EPROM devices use DRAM storage capacitors as coupling capacitors, allowing them to be manufactured simultaneously with DRAM devices without additional cost. The EPROM devices can be programmed and erased electrically, and they have a higher gate coupling ratio than current art EPROM devices, resulting in lower operation voltages. Another type of EPROM device, called stress effect programmable read-only memory (SEPROM), uses the damages caused by electrical stresses on common transistors to store data. SEPROM devices can be manufactured by any IC technology and are ideal for embedded applications, but they may have limitations in terms of writing speed and re-programmability.

<summary>
The invention relates to a method for determining the optimum values of feedback gains in a feedback control system, particularly in the context of automatic guidance vehicles (AGVs). The method involves provisionally determining a feedback gain, executing feedback control using the gain, detecting an error, calculating an evaluation value, and repeating the process with different gain values to determine the optimal gain. The evaluation value is calculated based on the error and is used to evaluate the stability, accuracy, and response of the control system. The method can be applied to determine the optimal values of proportional, integral, and differential gains. The invention is useful for AGVs that need to follow a predetermined course, and can be used in various applications such as warehouse management and manufacturing. The method can be implemented using a central processor and sensors that detect the AGV's deviation from the course. The optimal gain values can be determined in a short period of time and with high accuracy using this method.

<summary>
The invention relates to a zoom lens with a high relative aperture and a high zoom ratio, while maintaining a compact size and high optical performance. The lens consists of five units: a first unit for focusing, a second unit for varying magnification, a third unit for compensating for image plane shift, a fourth unit for making the light beam almost parallel, and a fifth unit for image formation. The lens design satisfies certain conditions to correct for aberrations and achieve good optical performance throughout the zooming range. The invention enables the creation of a compact zoom lens with a total length of 9.13φA to 9.19φA, making it suitable for use in photographic and video cameras. The lens design achieves a high relative aperture, high zoom ratio, and good optical performance, making it an improvement over existing zoom lenses.

<summary>
The invention relates to a method and device for detecting elementary particles, such as protons, ions, electrons, neutrons, and photons, in a detector. The method involves generating a charge pulse in the detector when a particle passes through, converting the pulse into an electric signal, and amplifying the signal in a fast amplifier for individual signals and a slow amplifier for integrating multiple signals. The device includes a detector, a support capacitor, and amplifiers, with the signal tapping on the low-voltage side to prevent interference from high-voltage cables. The invention enables both the detection of individual particles and the integration of multiple particles, without knowing the expected signal rates in advance.

<summary>
The invention relates to an apparatus for automatically spin checking driven disc assemblies used in friction clutches. The apparatus includes a test enclosure with a stationary ring and a movable ring that can be moved towards and away from each other to frictionally engage the driven disc assembly. A torque motor applies a predetermined torque to the assembly, and a position sensor measures the distance between the rings. The movable ring is gradually moved away from the stationary ring, and the distance is measured again when the assembly begins to rotate. The difference in distances is compared to a standard value to determine if the assembly is within specified tolerances. The apparatus automatically determines whether the assembly is good or bad and generates an external indication to the operator. The invention improves upon prior art by operating automatically, generating an external indication, and providing more accurate measurements. The apparatus can be used for statistical process control and minimizes the chances of operator error.

<summary>

The invention relates to face age-estimation and methods, systems, and software for estimating the age of a person from a digital image of their face. The method involves extracting facial features from the image using a contourlet appearance model (CAM) algorithm, and then classifying the face as either a youth or an adult using a support vector machine (SVM) classifier. The age is then estimated using a growth and development mapping function for youths or an adult aging mapping function for adults. The CAM algorithm is used to extract feature vectors from a database of landmarked face images, which are then used to train the SVM classifier and generate the aging functions. The system can be implemented using a computing device with a processor and memory, and can be used in various applications such as security systems, age verification, and customer demographics analysis. The method is robust against noise and can handle variations in lighting and facial expressions. The system can also provide a confidence factor indicating the accuracy of the estimated age. The invention can be used to estimate the age of a person from a single image, and can be integrated with other systems such as surveillance cameras and identity verification systems.

</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a matrix display device for displaying two merged images, one with a higher definition than the other. The device uses a mosaic of identical arrangements of pixels, with each arrangement having pixels dedicated to each image. The pixels are controlled by a controller that applies light intensity signals to form the merged image. The device can be used to display images from different sources, such as night vision and infrared sensors, and can correct for color saturation issues. The invention provides a way to display two images with different definitions and refresh frequencies, minimizing overall consumption.

<summary>
The invention relates to a mobile identification transmitter for keyless activation of a security system in a motor vehicle, which includes a payment element that can be removed from a receptacle in the housing to prevent unauthorized payment transactions. The payment element can be used for cashless payment transactions and can communicate with an electronic payment system, and the identification transmitter can be set to a secure state where the payment element is removed and the receptacle is sealed to prevent unauthorized access. The invention provides a convenient and secure way for users to make payments and access their vehicles without having to carry multiple cards or devices.

<summary>
The document describes a method and apparatus for charging toner in an imaging device, such as a xerographic machine, to maintain a consistent tribo charge level. The tribo charge of toner can decrease over time, affecting image quality, and the disclosed system adjusts the tribo charge based on periods of inactivity and user usage patterns. The system includes an inactivity determining section, a predicting section, a measuring section, a calculating section, an updating section, a storing section, a charging section, and a performing section. The method involves determining inactivity periods, predicting next user usage, measuring tribo charge levels, calculating decay, and charging the toner to a predetermined level before performing a printing operation.

<summary>
The invention relates to a rotary magnetic head type apparatus that can control the recording and reproduction of signals with high precision using plural magneto resistive heads (MR heads) mounted on a rotary drum. The apparatus uses a control signal generator, a decoder, and a rotary transformer to transmit control signals to the MR heads and regulate their bias currents, allowing for independent control of each head and high-speed data transfer.

<summary>

The invention relates to locating and tracing concealed elongated conductive objects, such as pipes or cables, particularly when a second object is adjacent to the first. Prior art methods use a transmitter to induce currents in non-ferrous metal pipes or cables and a receiver to sense the associated magnetic fields. However, when two cables are present, the output signal characteristic can be distorted, making it difficult to trace the desired cable. The present invention provides a system and method that improves the ease and accuracy of locating and tracing one concealed object in the presence of an adjacent object. The invention uses a transmitter with two antennae that induce distinguishable alternating currents in the two objects, and a receiver that senses both fields and produces an output signal dependent on both fields. The transmitter is optimally positioned relative to the cables to produce two distinct output signal nulls over the respective cables. The system can produce an output signal characteristic with two distinct nulls, allowing for easier and more accurate tracing of the desired cable. The invention is particularly useful when the horizontal separation between the cables is related to the depth of the cable to be located and traced. The system can be modified to use different techniques to make the currents distinguishable, such as using different carrier frequencies, amplitude modulation, or pulse rates.

</summary>

<summary>
The invention is an apparatus for interfacing a speaker phone with a telephone network, allowing for hands-free automatic answering and communication. The device includes a source of power, a selector switch, a coupler, and a timer, and can be used with a conventional telephone system. The apparatus can be set to answer incoming calls automatically and switch to a speaker phone, with the option to extend the call duration or terminate it after a predetermined time. The invention is designed to be portable, modular, and easy to install, making it suitable for various applications, including use by the physically handicapped or in business environments.

<summary>
The invention relates to a system for reducing or eliminating undersea optical repeaters in a trunk and branch ring network by replacing them with remotely pumped optical amplifiers. The system uses the branch fiber optic cable to transmit optical energy at a wavelength other than the signal wavelength to power the amplifiers. The amplifiers are located in the branch fiber optic cable, the optical fiber cable trunk, or the branching unit. The system has a ring topology with multiple hubs and branch assemblies, allowing for multipoint-to-multipoint connectivity and survivability in the event of a cable cut. The branch assemblies have a cable station, a light emitting power source, and an optical amplifier, and can be configured to add or drop signals from the trunk. The system can be used for undersea or terrestrial communications and can accommodate different types of multiplexing and wavelengths. The invention reduces the number of undersea repeaters required, making it more cost-effective and efficient. The system is flexible and can be reconfigured as needed to accommodate changes in telecommunications traffic.

<summary>
The invention is a cover plate device for wall-mounted electrical wiring devices that hides fasteners and provides a finished look. The device consists of an attachment plate that is installed over a wiring device and a cover plate that is attached to the attachment plate without visible fasteners. The attachment plate has latching pawls that engage saw-tooth shaped racks on the cover plate, allowing for easy installation and removal. The device can accommodate variations in wall flatness and evenness, and can be used with multiple wiring devices. The cover plate has no fastener holes and only has apertures to receive wiring device projections. The invention provides a quick and easy installation and removal process using simple tools and available fasteners.

<summary>
The present invention relates to a collapsible light-shielding device for a screen, such as a television or monitor, to prevent irritating reflections of natural or artificial light. The device consists of concentrically nested annular strips that can be fixed in front of the screen and slide over each other between a pushed-in and pushed-out position. The strips have a decreasing wall thickness in the axial direction, allowing the device to be set to various angular positions relative to the screen, enabling viewing from different angles. The device can be easily fitted to a monitor using an adapter member and can be folded up to take up minimal space when not in use. The strips can be made of solid design or produced by bending plate material and may include hook elements or locking elements to ensure reliable folding-in and folding-out. The invention provides a reliable, inexpensive, and easy-to-use light-shielding device that can be adapted to various types of monitors.

<summary>
